Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: John-W010
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean. It had an adjoining smaller sitting room with a couch. Bed was very large and comfortable. Conveniently located close to good restaurants and harbor activities. Only bad experience was street noise and airplanes taking off from San Diego Airport. If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs or noise canceling earphones. Front desk staff very helpful and friendly. This is a good hotel if you are in need of clean cheaper accommodations while in San Diego. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: jennyd83
Reviews.Content: My friend was getting married at the Navy submarine base, so this was a very convenient location. However, there are several things that I was very unhappy with: (1) Parking lot is tiny and very difficult to maneuver car in. (2) Comforter had cigarette burn hole, openly displayed, on it. (3) Couch was broken and cushion did not sit properly (4) Shower door was TINY. If I was a large person, I would have not been able to take a shower. (5) Broken tile in entry way of room. (6) Room was non smoking but smelled of smoke. (7) No pool or hot tub. Would I stay here again? Probably not. I think I'd look for another Comfort Inn at another location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: LiketoTravel2012
Reviews.Content: This was a nice property and good value for the money. It was a great jumping off point for Mission Valley and Coronado and San Diego overall. The staff were very pleasant -- front desk and housekeeping. Breakfast was fine -- and the bed was comfortable. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beds were hard, other tenants were loud. Restless nights & bruised hips”
Reviews.Author: Jodilynna
Reviews.Content: The rooms were odd and not comfortable. The beds were so hard I had bruised hips the next day. It's WAY over priced for what you get and the front desk wouldn't confront the man running a marathon all night in the room above us or the group "partying" til 3am next door. They were nice enough to move us the second night after getting no sleep the first, but paying $100 a night is not even close to worth it. I would never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Last stop before flying home”
Reviews.Author: Countryman36
Reviews.Content: Stayed our last nite in California at this hotel. It is an older property, but well maintained, and they treated us very kindly. We appreciated them.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: Peg C
Reviews.Content: We are two adults age 50+. We wanted to stay on Point Loma to be close to our sightseeing options. We wanted free parking, a good breakfast, and hopefully WI-FI, all at a decent price. This place was great for us. We even got a free newspaper every weekday. We stayed just over a week. We started our day with a good choice of breakfast foods, cold cereal, hot cereal, hot eggs, sausages, chilled hard cooked eggs, plus beverage choices. We generally left for the day after breakfast to do our sightseeing. We would eat our lunch out enjoying the variety of cuisines avaialble in San Diego. We would return to our room and find it a wonderful retreat from our busy day. We could enjoy cable tv, reading our paper, or using our laptop. We slept well. I am a light sleeper; my partner is not. I slept thru the night well. I could not hear people in other rooms, and the traffic was definitely not an issue. The bathroom is small, but clean and has everything you need. During our stay the rooms got flat screen tv's, which we totally liked. We found the staff friendly and very attentive. We would stay here again if we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Positives outway the negatives”
Reviews.Author: Red456838
Reviews.Content: We chose this inn primarilly because of it's cost (comparible to other options & factoring free parking) and location - it is within 10 minutes of the airport and convennient to freeways. This inn is not a choice for light sleepers: the inn is right on North Harbor between 2 busy intersections and traffic noise is constant. We prebooked 3 nights the first part of our vacation, travelled to LA, then returned for 2 nights. Both times we were on the 2nd floor. The staff are friendly and accomodating (stored our large suitcase while in LA and offered us a choice of rooms). The inn provides clean, basic accomodations with comfortable beds and fridge. Bathrooms are very small with showers (no tubs). Some rooms have a second space with with a pull out sofa. It also has a pool and patio area and offers a satisfying complimentary breakfast with fruit, yoghurt, cereal, eggs, sausage, waffles etc. WiFi connection was fine. There's nothing "wrong" with this inn, there's just plenty of other options in that area (Radisson, Best Western, Holiday Inn) or within a short driving distance (Sports Blvd or Hotel Circle) we would have considered for the later part of our stay if we hadn't prebooked or if we visit SD again.

Reviews.Title: “If not for the roaches, this would be a positive review.”
Reviews.Author: NotAskingForMuch2011
Reviews.Content: I arrived for a 3 night stay at this hotel and was pleased by the friendliness of the staff working here. I went to my room and found an unusually laid out, but generally not bad little room with a comfortable bed. Bathroom was small, but functional and appeared clean. The second night there, I ordered a pizza. I put the leftovers in the fridge and left the box on top of the fridge. I got up at midnight to get a drink, turned on the lights, and saw cockroaches all over the box and wall near the fridge. Immediately called the front desk and they were very apologetic and moved me to a different room on the 2nd floor (first room was a ground floor room). I examined that room to the best of my ability and didn't see anything, so I stayed that night in that room. The next afternoon after returning to the room, I went into the bathroom and had another roach scurry across the floor. I packed my things, went to the front desk, demanded a refund (which, to their credit, they did provide), and went and stayed at the Holiday Inn up the block. More expensive, but not the wild kingdom either. This could have been a very nice little budget hotel with good breakfast options, but roaches are never acceptable at any price point.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jimho2036
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge disappointment. For the price ($89.95/night) we had way better accommodations on our recent 3 week tour of CA, AZ, UT and CO. The room appeared to have been furnished with items from local second-hand shops. Furniture was arranged helter-skelter. WI-FI was marginal to non-existent. The room smelled bad.I would not stay here again, and I think anybody who has stayed here would feel the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Modest But Very Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: aebi46
Reviews.Content: This is an older Comfort Inn property with modest, clean rooms within steps of the harbor and fine restaurants (we particularly enjoyed the Pizza Nova) and convenience of a Navy Exchange (NEX) four short blocks away. What truly makes it a delight is "A.J. and Tim" at reception who were extremely friendly, courteous and highly articulate. Both of these gentlemen were solicitous and helpful in providing us with information and scheduling a van pickup from the hotel to the B Street Terminal a few miles away for our Holland America cruise to Hawaii. The hotel, as typical with most Comfort Inns attracts mostly mature retirees who are very considerate and respectful of other hotel occupants. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: CindyLou28
Reviews.Content: Here I sit at the Comfort Inn wishing I was at a nicer hotel. This Hotel is average. There is nothing special about it. If you don;t care if it isn't up to date then this is the place for you. I wish I could leave but we are locked in. So spend a little more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ltno
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay in this hotel based on the price and the reviews I read on it. When we first walked in the room I noticed a musty smell in the room which went away after an hour or two that the AC was running. The bathroom faucets were not in the best shape. Small bathroom size overall. The toilet didn't flush a couple of times so I had to play with the toilet tank to get it working. I even had to fill it by hand multiple times. Their continental breakfast ran from 6:30 to 9:30. We showed up at 9:15 and there was no coffee, no syrup, only two bananas left, and the trash cans were full. If I am in the area again, I will definitely look for other places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the area”
Reviews.Author: SteveW196
Reviews.Content: very close to party boat fishing in San Diego. Downside is if you are not a fisherman, these folks get up very early to catch the boat and are fairly loud in the parking lot. The room was clean and the included breakfast had a good, but simple, variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tonya2011
Reviews.Content: The decor was pleasant and the staff was friendly and attentive. Pillowtop mattresses, updated decor. Reasonble sized room, small bathroom. Continental breakfast. Free but very limited parking. Free Wi-Fi. Close to restaurants, harbor and other retail. Would defintely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic!”
Reviews.Author: KLene
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a working trip in May. Coming from Singapore and having just stayed 4 days at Park Hyatt, this inn was a bit of a shock. Its a scene from Hollywood movie. The whole area is very open. Anyone can walk in and out of the compound. I did not feel safe at all when I first arrived. The room is very basic, clean and a bit small. The location is very NEAR the airport and a ride on Supershuttle pick-up to Airport will only cost $ 5 before tips. If you have a car, it is easy to get to anywhere. I did not hear any sound from aeroplanes. I also did not hear a sound from the slamming of door since my room was just next to the breakfast room. Apparently my room was facing a small road. I heard other guests complaining of noise coming from traffic. Breakfast is not impressive. Imagine my surprise that I was charged insurance $2 per day for using the room safe which I did not use! Have you ever stay at an inn or motel that charges insurance for usage of room safe? Think about it! Staff were friendly which is a plus. I will only recommend this Inn if you need to stay near the airport and if you are not a solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - average accommodation”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Fish
Reviews.Content: STAFF: AJ very hospitable & welcoming. Would stay again. ROOMS: older hotel. Good value. Everything we needed. Wifi, breakfast, free parking. Squeaky floors & bed (luckily we were on top floor). Only small people would fit in shower door (compact bathroom). Nice having separate room for luggage. LOCATION: Point Loma is a boat lovers dream spot. Over the hill to Ocean Beach. Cabrillo Nat Monument open to 5pm - $5/car. FOOD: Miguel’s Mexican – sickly sweet cocktails w/o alcohol, free starter but made us remember why we don’t like Mexican Food:{

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag, Standard with nice locale”
Reviews.Author: Angell66
Reviews.Content: We reserved a Snooze and Cruise one night room with parking for a week. Great value at $139. Their shuttle service to port was excellent and on time both ways. Front staff was patient with guests and answered questions well. Small area for parking, but we didn't have a problem. What's good...right on the SD harbor, good front desk staff, nice cruise plan/stay provided with excellent service with their contract with shuttle service. Not so fine...room and bathroom tiny, extra couch unsleepable pulled out, so slept on top, not comfy either, and too short. Pretty standard, but if you want the cruise plan, it's helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay minus rude check-out”
Reviews.Author: SDballer
Reviews.Content: Everything about the room was satisfying. The check in with "AJ" was excellent as he was very courteous and helpful in questions we had. The only complaint from the stay was when we proceeded to check out we got a "don't care to talk to you just goodbye" attitude from "AJA" the front desk clerk. We weren't even being over spoken , just small talk where the clerk proceeded to reply to every question or statement with a few words then didn't seem to want to talk at all. I said I was checking out, all she did was ask for the room # then set "ok you're good" and no thank you or hope your enjoyed your stay or anything. Seemed a very rude attitude when I expect the employee to be trained in wanting to make the guests come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LEGrayNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort in for 2 nights during a day trip to San Diego. The outside of the hotel was a little shabby. We were greeted by a friendly CSR. He was very helpful w/info and getting us checked in. Our room was adequate and clean. The remote didn't work well. We did a day tour in San Diego and decided that we were too tired to return back to Los Angeles. So, we reserved another night. We were able to do so at the same rate as the night before which was a prepaid rate. Our second room seemed larger and nicer. Had problems w/the heat but it wasn't a huge problem. Overall, very good stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasent Experiance”
Reviews.Author: ZAZULibertyUtah
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this motel. Room was fine and the personel were very helpful. Both our stays were before a cruise leaving San Diego, we will definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Thenunez
Reviews.Content: I came down to San Diego to preform in Downtown at a Jazz Bar. and wasn't able to check in until 11:30 pm. I was pleased that they honored their late check in policy. I stayed on the second floor near the busy street but wasn't disturbed at all during my stay. I'm assuming they have sound proof windows and door seals? also when I had to leave back home at 6am for work there was fresh coffee ready for us. overall I would say i had a great time and when I'm due back in San Diego I will be sure to check here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experiences, will be back again.”
Reviews.Author: tedwardthe3rd
Reviews.Content: at first I didn't know what to expect because of the low rate i was getting, but I have to say I had a really good time. Rooms were nice, very up to date. a/c, cable, wifi everything i needed for my trip to san diego. pool was key! i stayed on the second floor right by the pool and got a nice tan lounging on the deck most of the day. oh didi i mention its was about 2 to 3 miles from all the places i was going. seaworld, the beach, zoo, &downtown. this was a good choice for me and im sure ill be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fleabag motel doesn't begin to describe it”
Reviews.Author: jcwbnimble
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and two young children) were heading to San Diego for a wedding on the bluffs of Point Loma. The bride had suggested this motel and another in the general vicinity. Mind you, the bride is living back east and only made the lodging suggestions based on locale. To give you an idea of the area, we noticed a large population of transients on Rosecrans within several blocks of the hotel. Thankfully there were none on the actual hotel property, but plenty could be seen at the Winchells right across the street. We arrived at the hotel and checked in at 8pm with no problems. One nice thing about it being such a small hotel, you park right in front of the rooms. The downside of it being such a small hotel, you can hear the cars pull up at all hours of the night. It literally sounds like someone is pulling into your room. The door and windows are not soundproof. Right off the bat you notice that the room is very small. There are only three drawers to store clothes in, despite the room being setup for 4 people. The closet is a little aclove, but was large enough considering we only had one set of clothes for each person that needed to be hung up. The bathroom was little more than a converted closet. You had to shove the door against the toilet in order to get into the bathroom. The sink countertop hung over the toilet so you had to lean forward to sit down. There was no ventilation inside the bathroom so you have to open the window to keep smells from getting into the rest of the hotel room. Upon opening the window, I noticed that the low-rent apartments next door could look right down into the bathroom. The only good thing about the whole room is that fact that the showerhead is a full flow massage unit. You are gonna need it because the main mattress is hard as a rock. I took my own pillow to make sure I would comfortable, and I still woke up with a sore back. Oh, did I mention that there is NO SOUNDPROOFING between the top and bottom floor. If you absolutely must stay at this motel, get a room on the 2nd floor. My wife and I were awakened at 2am by the people upstairs. It sounded like they were wearing lead shoes and throwing their luggage around the room. I would most definitely not recommend this hotel to my friends. I wouldn't even recommend it to my worst enemy. For $140 a night, I expect more than this little fleabag motel has to offer. It's not like there is a shortage of hotels in San Diego. The worst hotel on Motel Row is ten times nicer than this "motel".

Reviews.Title: “Yikes.”
Reviews.Author: Stacers28NY
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that Tripadvisor has ever steered me wrong. I was expecting a typical motel- a bit grungy but overall ok for the price. What I got was...kind of ick! And I honestly don't think my standards are very high. My room had paint peeling off the walls, giant moths flittering about, the bathroom door did not close, the showerhead only came up to below my neck (and I am only 5'7!!), the bedspread had huge stains on it...I was kind of grossed out. The parking lot was a whole other story. Big SUVs would consistently park where it said compact cars only, so my car kept getting trapped in the lot, at night there was no parking spots left (and there were vacancies, so what you would do if it was full is beyond me) once when I came home a car had parked in the middle of the driveway. The breakfast was only until 9:30, so forget sleeping in. By 9:30 the coffee was ice cold anyway, and typically all that was left by then was an orange and some bread. The location was great- right down the block from Point Loma seafood, which was ideal since there is never any parking there, and very close to the airport. But aside form the location...I really do not recommend this hotel. maybe if it was $50/night, but not even worth the $70/night I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: nmgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week last summer while our kids went to Sea World camp. The room was clean although barely big enough for the furniture, but it did have a table and chairs, a fridge+microwave, and a fold-out couch in a small side room as well as the main bed, so it was OK. Location was great: easy access to the harbor and San Diego proper, 5 minutes' drive from Trader Joe's, and quick access to Sea World with almost no rush-hour congestion (we drove the route up Nimitz Blvd twice a day for camp dropoff/pickup). Rates were very reasonable and we made good use of the pool. Guest laundry worked. Close to the airport on a corner just off busy Harbor Blvd but no problem with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lan242
Reviews.Content: The hotel room itself was small and dark. Service was okay. The one thing that set me off the most was the fact that the ALARM went off at 2am in the morning!!! It was only in my room!! My boyfriend and I went to the complain and all the guy had to say was he apologized. No compensation whatsoever. I'm not staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Amenities Is Lie”
Reviews.Author: dw1014
Reviews.Content: I'm very dissapointed to stay in here. I take a lot of times looking a right place to stay. I read in the tripadvisor and look at the hotel website it seems good, but in reality super suck. First of all, the bathroom is small. Comfort Inn adverstised they have "heated pool" , I call them in the beginning of October to make sure the pool still heated and they said yes. When I went to the pool with my spouse I'm very angry, it's not working. One of the reason we want to stay here because of the heated pool. In the room, the hair dryer also did not work. Finally, when I check out I complain to the front desk, but he just said "we will tell the maintainance to check it out" errrrrrr, I'm super angry for all this situation. What the hotel put in their website about all their amenities is a LIEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE. I will never stay there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel, just north of the Airport”
Reviews.Author: CaAz-JT
Reviews.Content: We try to stay at a Comfort Inn when we are traveling on our own (for the points) and this one concerned me...until we showed up. The property is right across the street from the harbor and in a very nice neighborhood. I thought it was going to be 'run down' but it appears the motel has been renovated recently and everything is in great shape. We asked for a king size bed and got a room that had a small room off the side with a fold out bed. We could have put 2 other people in here easily. The staff is very friendly and called to make sure we were happy with the accomodations. Although we are just up from the airport, you don't hear the planes taking off. This is a much quieter motel than I was expecting. Downtown San Diego is only about 4 miles down Harbor Drive, it's nice to be 'away' from the hustle and bustle. The property is actually in Point Loma, but San Diego is just a stone's throw down the road. All in all, we are very happy with the room and the price was reasonable ($112 + tax / night). If you are looking for reasonably priced accomodations, this might be the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrading in a BIG way”
Reviews.Author: APairaDocs
Reviews.Content: This is an older building that is limited by when it was build. The management is pouring money into this place and it shows. The breakfast was OK. Coffee and refrigerator in the room Room was very clean and odor free. I stayed there two months ago and came back. No elevator for second floor access, is about the only complaint I would have, but they put me in a first floor room so I don't have that complaint. It is a Comfort Inn in an older building. Everyone was helpful and pleasant and went out above and beyond to be cordial. I liked the location. Right on Harbor Blvd. and just a short hop from the airport and easy to get to all the attractions and Shelter Island. On the corner of Rosecrans and Harbor. You can get to the Interstates down Rosecrans and downtown on Harbor. Went to Cabrillo National Park nearby for a breathtaking view of North Island and San Diego. Don't miss a second floor restaurant on Shelter Island Drive (??Something??) on the Green. Sorry can't remember the name but the food was great and there are not that many restaurants on nearby Shelter Island Drive that are on the second floor. Ask and they will tell you. Get there before 6 PM for the value early deals. Great food and service. Try the home made potato chips!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Gordtiz
Reviews.Content: stayed there pre & post cruise, clean, tidy rooms, shopping & restaurants within walking distance, complimentary breakfast was really good, close to airport & cruise terminal, we found it relitivley quiet even though there were some renovations underway, should be a real nice place when they finish, only hope they don't increase the price too much, only problem they only have one handicapp room, which was booked on our return, it would be a good idea to have more than one, the room they gave us instead was satisfactory although access to the shower was not good, they did however offer to try to get us a handicapp room at another hotel which we decided against as we found the service & breakfast made up for the inconvenience, we found the staff friendly & helpfull

Reviews.Title: “It's a really really nice place”
Reviews.Author: monechka
Reviews.Content: Well guys, I spent two night in this hotel during November, 2007 and it was a really cool place to stay. I booked a single room, and they got me a king size bed:) I also liked the furniture and overall decor of the room. Breakfast was'nt very good except waffles, these were great. Location: it is quite far from downtown, but it is nice and cosy Don't be afraid to stay there:)

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_from_Omaha
Reviews.Content: I read some on-line reviews of this hotel before arrival, and I feel the property managers/owners have possibly made some improvements since those reviews were written. Criticisms: Room is on the small size, as is the bathroom, and refrigerator. The walls are VERY THIN! I am hard of hearing, but I could clearly hear people next door engaged in casual conversation. There is nothing that can be done to remedy it, but it is a NOISY location, and the parking lot is barely adequate. A few times, I was the last vehicle able to get a parking spot. There was a LOT of renovation going on at the hotel, mostly seemed to be cutting tile, and that contributed to the noise. This was limited to day-time, and did not negatively impact me in any way. Congrats: The front desk staff is some of thre nicest, most helpful people I have encountered in any hotel/motel. I often stay at far more expensive hotels, and I wish the staff there were this congenial. Bed was comfortable. The room and shower were clean. The WIFI worked well, but avoid something called SDBAYFREEWIFI. Once you make the unfortunte decision to connect to this wireless network, it seems impossible to remove it from your computer, or to de-select it as your default network. VERY close to the airport, Marine base, and loads of good places to eat. I would definitely recommend this for a short-term stay, for those on a budget, or those who are unfamiliar with the area. All in all I was pleasantly surprised. I would assign it a solid C grade. I think the fact that it is named Comfort Inn leads to some disappointment. It is unlike any other Comfort Inn I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: bizarrogir
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, this is a Comfort Inn, a motel. Dont expect a 5 star hotel. I don't know if they changed things after the last reviews, but it was a decent place. The room was a bit small, but not ridiculously tiny, the bathroom was very small. Everything was clean, the bed was made properly, and everything worked. They had air conditioning and a mini fridge. The guy at the front desk was very friendly and even gave us restaurant recommendations and a card for a free appetizer. The location was decent and not sketchy - we walked about 3 blocks at night to the restaurant and saw no shady people. The complimentary breakfast was better than I expected, with lots of different choices (and they had waffles).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dump at all costs”
Reviews.Author: FernandoBee
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels that I have ever stayed. This has a recipe for disaster as far as bad luck in travelling: paper thin walls, clogged toilets, dirty sheets, hair in the bathroom, idiots who hog the disabled parking without appropriate plates, stale food for the continental breakfast, small "cells" as a seperate room, iron and ironing boards that are rotten. I can go on and on about this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Gross, gross, gross”
Reviews.Author: REF21
Reviews.Content: This place is truly a dump. I travel often, and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Seriously. The shower, when I arrived, had a hair on the wall. That same hair was still there 3 days later when I left. So, the shower was never cleaned? The toilet made a hidious noise when it flushed. The first morning it made the noise, I thought someone had screamed outside my bathroom window. Also, the noise was a huge issue. Sounded like elephants were walking above me, yet I am sure it was typical walking from the people upstairs. It sounded like I was literally in the middle of Rosecrans street, which is literally steps away from the door. I literally tried to touch nothing while I was there. Dirty and gross. Folks, it is that bad. Please don't stay here if you have any other option.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the brand name. The Comfort Inn people clearly bought up this dumpy motel -- which probably had been called "The Sun n' Surf or something similar-- slapped their sign on it and doubled (or tripled) the price. Although the website describes it as a "boutique-style" motel, what you can really look forward to are paper thin walls, kids getting drunk and racuous in the parking lot and a seedy neighborhood where the place next door rents rooms by the hour. You might do better at one of the locally-owned dumps. At least they're honest about what they are.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, noisy, not as expected.”
Reviews.Author: LovePuertoVallarta
Reviews.Content: I booked this room off Expedia. As usual, Expedia led me to believe I was getting a lot more than I did! The room was comfortable with a small refrigerator placed on the floor. Outside is very dull-looking. No extras here! Desk clerks varied from "couldn't care less to friendly". VERY NOISY many nights. Office let people stand outside laughing and talking loudly for hours around midnight. (May have been visiting the desk clerk?) Shower door broken. Hairdryer outlet didn't work... so no hairdryer. Same stuff on bathroom floor a week later- not thoroughly cleaned. Bed rumpled- no fitted sheets. Location was OK.... close to airport and bus line. Easy to get to attractions via bus except for San Diego Zoo. Surrounded by Fast Food... restaurants in the area weren't clean. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Check-in and out was easy.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn At The Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 5102 North Harbor Drive, San Diego, CA 92106
